DataElement.preferredName: Organ Tissue Removed by Surgical Procedure Begin Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time at which removal of brain tissue from the donor started.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Organ Tissue Removed by Surgical Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions.  It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.  Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._Removed; taken out of or separated from._(SERJ-uh-ree) A procedure to remove or repair a part of the body or to find out whether disease is present.  An operation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A part of the body that performs a specific function.  For example, the heart is an organ.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:Removed; taken out of or separated from.

Concepts.definition: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
Taken out of, separated from, or eliminated.

Property.preferredDefinition: Surgical Procedure is a diagnostic or treatment medical procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
